meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The dupers in the story were always trying to trick the main character.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he was a dupers and had taken advantage of her trust.
meanings.sent3: The dupers thought he could outsmart everyone, but he ended up getting caught.
meanings.sent4: The world of politics is often filled with dupers who manipulate the truth for their gain.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the dupers who pretend to be your friends but have hidden agendas.

meanings.sent1: He tried to dupers his way out of trouble by lying about his whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to dupers her friends, so she decided to tell them the truth.
meanings.sent3: The magician was able to dupers the audience with his incredible illusions.
meanings.sent4: The scammer was skilled at dupers unsuspecting victims into giving him money.
meanings.sent5: The spy used his charm to dupers the enemy into revealing their plans.

meanings.sent1: The dupers advertisement promised a product that was too good to be true.
meanings.sent2: She had a feeling that his smile was dupers and hid his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast turned out to be dupers, as it rained all day despite the prediction of sunshine.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talking was dupers, concealing his lack of sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The seemingly innocent email turned out to be a dupers attempt to steal personal information.
